abstract: Why do powerful men with so much to lose do such stupid things? The risk-reward tradeoff doesn’t seem to make sense. Some economic studies may shed some light on this question, though.
snippet: Why do powerful men with so much to lose do such stupid things? The risk-reward tradeoff doesn’t seem to make sense. Some economic studies may shed some light on this question, though.
lead_paragraph: Maureen Dowd, among others, observed in Tuesday’s paper that many of the recent examples of men behaving badly were perpetrated by men married to powerful, independently successful wives, on whom some of the cheaters were financially dependent. And with so much political power and celebrity of their own at stake, there was even more reason to avoid boneheaded decisions like texting crotch-shots to strangers or impregnating the housekeeper.

headline.main: The Economics of Men Behaving Badly
